sinaiticus.text: but some fearful looking for of judgment, and fiery indignation that shall devour the adversaries.

verses.text: but some fearful looking for of judgment, and fiery indignation that shall devour the adversaries.

sinaiticus.text: Any one that has set aside the law of Moses dies without mercy under two or three witnesses:

verses.text: Any one that has set aside the law of Moses dies without mercy under two or three witnesses:

sinaiticus.text: of how much severer punishment think you he shall be thought worthy, who has trod under foot the Son of God, and has counted the blood of the covenant, with which he was sanctified, a common thing, and has outraged the Spirit of grace?

verses.text: of how much severer punishment think you he shall be thought worthy, who has trod under foot the Son of God, and has counted the blood of the covenant, with which he was sanctified, a common thing, and has outraged the Spirit of grace?

sinaiticus.text: For we know him that said: Vengeance is mine, I will repay, says the Lord: and again: The Lord will judge his people.

verses.text: For we know him that said: Vengeance is mine, I will repay, says the Lord: and again: The Lord will judge his people.

sinaiticus.text: It is a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living God.

verses.text: It is a fearful thing to fall into the hands of the living God.

sinaiticus.text: But call to mind the former days, in which after you were enlightened you endured a great conflict of sufferings,

verses.text: But call to mind the former days, in which after you were enlightened you endured a great conflict of sufferings,

sinaiticus.text: partly being made a spectacle both by reproaches and afflictions, partly having become companions of those that were thus treated.

verses.text: partly being made a spectacle both by reproaches and afflictions, partly having become companions of those that were thus treated.

sinaiticus.text: For you sympathized with these in bonds, and accepted with joy the seizing of your goods, knowing that you have for yourselves a better possession and one that endures.

verses.text: For you sympathized with these in bonds, and accepted with joy the seizing of your goods, knowing that you have for yourselves a better possession and one that endures.

sinaiticus.text: Cast not away, then, your confidence, which has great recompense of reward.

verses.text: Cast not away, then, your confidence, which has great recompense of reward.

sinaiticus.text: For you have need of patience, that after having done the will of God you may receive the promise.

verses.text: For you have need of patience, that after having done the will of God you may receive the promise.

sinaiticus.text: For yet a little, very little while, He that comes will come and will not delay:

verses.text: For yet a little, very little while, He that comes will come and will not delay:

sinaiticus.text: But my righteous man shall live by faith, and if he draw back, my soul shall have no pleasure in him.

verses.text: But my righteous man shall live by faith, and if he draw back, my soul shall have no pleasure in him.

sinaiticus.text: But we are not of fearfulness for perdition, but of faith for the preservation of the soul.

verses.text: But we are not of fearfulness for perdition, but of faith for the preservation of the soul.

sinaiticus.text: And faith is confidence as to things hoped for, conviction as to things not seen.

verses.text: And faith is confidence as to things hoped for, conviction as to things not seen.

sinaiticus.text: For in this the elders obtained a good report.

verses.text: For in this the elders obtained a good report.

sinaiticus.text: By faith we understand that the ages were set in order by the word of God, so that not from things that appear has that which is seen come into being.

verses.text: By faith we understand that the ages were set in order by the word of God, so that not from things that appear has that which is seen come into being.

sinaiticus.text: By faith Abel offered to God more sacrifice than Cain, through which he obtained testimony that he was righteous, God testifying in regard to his gifts, and through it he though dead yet speaks.402

verses.text: By faith Abel offered to God more sacrifice than Cain, through which he obtained testimony that he was righteous, God testifying in regard to his gifts, and through it he though dead yet speaks.402

sinaiticus.text: By faith Enoch was translated that he should not see death, and was not found because God translated him. For before the translation he had the testimony that he pleased God;

verses.text: By faith Enoch was translated that he should not see death, and was not found because God translated him. For before the translation he had the testimony that he pleased God;

sinaiticus.text: and without faith it is impossible to please him; for he that comes to God must believe that he is, and that he becomes a rewarder of those that diligently seek him.

verses.text: and without faith it is impossible to please him; for he that comes to God must believe that he is, and that he becomes a rewarder of those that diligently seek him.

sinaiticus.text: By faith Noah, having been warned of things not yet seen, moved with reverence, prepared an ark for the salvation of his house, through which faith he condemned the world, and became an heir of the righteousness according to faith.

verses.text: By faith Noah, having been warned of things not yet seen, moved with reverence, prepared an ark for the salvation of his house, through which faith he condemned the world, and became an heir of the righteousness according to faith.

sinaiticus.text: By faith Abraham, being called, became obedient in going forth into a place which he should after receive for an inheritance, and he went forth not knowing whither he was going.

verses.text: By faith Abraham, being called, became obedient in going forth into a place which he should after receive for an inheritance, and he went forth not knowing whither he was going.

sinaiticus.text: By faith he sojourned in the land of promise as a foreign land, having dwelt in tents, with Isaac and Jacob, heirs with him of the same promise;

verses.text: By faith he sojourned in the land of promise as a foreign land, having dwelt in tents, with Isaac and Jacob, heirs with him of the same promise;

sinaiticus.text: for he looked for the city that has the foundations, of which the architect and builder is God.

verses.text: for he looked for the city that has the foundations, of which the architect and builder is God.

sinaiticus.text: By faith also Sarah herself received strength for the conception of seed even beyond the time of life, because she counted him faithful that had promised.

verses.text: By faith also Sarah herself received strength for the conception of seed even beyond the time of life, because she counted him faithful that had promised.

sinaiticus.text: Wherefore there sprung even from one, and that, too, having become dead, as the stars of heaven in number, and as the sand that is along the seashore, innumerable.

verses.text: Wherefore there sprung even from one, and that, too, having become dead, as the stars of heaven in number, and as the sand that is along the seashore, innumerable.

sinaiticus.text: According to faith died all these, not having received the promises, but having seen them at a distance and saluted them, and confessed that they were strangers and sojourners in the land.

verses.text: According to faith died all these, not having received the promises, but having seen them at a distance and saluted them, and confessed that they were strangers and sojourners in the land.

sinaiticus.text: For they that say such things show plainly that they seek a country.

verses.text: For they that say such things show plainly that they seek a country.

sinaiticus.text: And if indeed they had had in mind that from which they came, they would have had opportunity to return;

verses.text: And if indeed they had had in mind that from which they came, they would have had opportunity to return;

sinaiticus.text: but now they desire a better; that is, a heavenly. Wherefore God is not ashamed to be called their God; for he has prepared for them a city.

verses.text: but now they desire a better; that is, a heavenly. Wherefore God is not ashamed to be called their God; for he has prepared for them a city.

sinaiticus.text: By faith Abraham when tried offered up Isaac, even the firstborn did he offer up who had received the promises,

verses.text: By faith Abraham when tried offered up Isaac, even the firstborn did he offer up who had received the promises,

sinaiticus.text: of whom it was said: In Isaac shall thy posterity be called;

verses.text: of whom it was said: In Isaac shall thy posterity be called;

sinaiticus.text: accounting that God was able to raise even from the dead: whence, also, he received him back in a figure.

verses.text: accounting that God was able to raise even from the dead: whence, also, he received him back in a figure.

sinaiticus.text: By faith also Isaac blessed Jacob and Esau concerning things to come.

verses.text: By faith also Isaac blessed Jacob and Esau concerning things to come.

sinaiticus.text: By faith Jacob, when dying, blessed each of the sons of Joseph,

verses.text: By faith Jacob, when dying, blessed each of the sons of Joseph,

sinaiticus.text: By faith Joseph, when dying, made mention of the departure of the sons of Israel, and gave commandment concerning his bones.

verses.text: By faith Joseph, when dying, made mention of the departure of the sons of Israel, and gave commandment concerning his bones.

sinaiticus.text: By faith Moses, after he had been born, was concealed three months by his parents, because they saw that the child was beautiful, and they were not afraid of the commandment of the king.

verses.text: By faith Moses, after he had been born, was concealed three months by his parents, because they saw that the child was beautiful, and they were not afraid of the commandment of the king.

sinaiticus.text: By faith Moses, when he became of age, refused to be called the son of Pharaoh’s daughter,

verses.text: By faith Moses, when he became of age, refused to be called the son of Pharaoh’s daughter,

sinaiticus.text: rather choosing to suffer evil with the people of God than to have a temporary enjoyment of sin,

verses.text: rather choosing to suffer evil with the people of God than to have a temporary enjoyment of sin,

sinaiticus.text: esteeming the reproach of Christ greater riches than the treasures of Egypt; for he looked away to the recompense of reward.

verses.text: esteeming the reproach of Christ greater riches than the treasures of Egypt; for he looked away to the recompense of reward.

sinaiticus.text: By faith he left Egypt, not being afraid of the wrath of the king; for he endured as seeing him that is invisible.

verses.text: By faith he left Egypt, not being afraid of the wrath of the king; for he endured as seeing him that is invisible.

sinaiticus.text: By faith he kept the Passover and the sprinkling of blood, that he that destroyed the firstborn might not touch them.

verses.text: By faith he kept the Passover and the sprinkling of blood, that he that destroyed the firstborn might not touch them.

sinaiticus.text: By faith they passed through the Red Sea as over dry ground, which the Egyptians attempting to do were drowned.

verses.text: By faith they passed through the Red Sea as over dry ground, which the Egyptians attempting to do were drowned.

sinaiticus.text: By faith the walls of Jericho fell down, after they had been surrounded for seven days.

verses.text: By faith the walls of Jericho fell down, after they had been surrounded for seven days.

sinaiticus.text: By faith Rahab the harlot perished not with those that believed not, because she received the spies with peace.

verses.text: By faith Rahab the harlot perished not with those that believed not, because she received the spies with peace.

sinaiticus.text: And what do I say more? For the time would fail me, should I tell of Gideon, Barak also and Samson and Jephtha, of David also and of Samuel and the prophets,

verses.text: And what do I say more? For the time would fail me, should I tell of Gideon, Barak also and Samson and Jephtha, of David also and of Samuel and the prophets,

sinaiticus.text: who through faith subdued kingdoms, worked righteousness, obtained promises, stopped the mouths of lions,

verses.text: who through faith subdued kingdoms, worked righteousness, obtained promises, stopped the mouths of lions,

sinaiticus.text: quenched the violence of fire, escaped the edge of the sword, from weakness were made strong, became mighty in war, turned to flight armies of foreigners;

verses.text: quenched the violence of fire, escaped the edge of the sword, from weakness were made strong, became mighty in war, turned to flight armies of foreigners;

sinaiticus.text: women received their dead after a resurrection; and others were beaten to death, not accepting deliverance, that they might obtain a better resurrection;

verses.text: women received their dead after a resurrection; and others were beaten to death, not accepting deliverance, that they might obtain a better resurrection;

sinaiticus.text: but others had trial of mockings and scourgings, and further of bonds and imprisonment:

verses.text: but others had trial of mockings and scourgings, and further of bonds and imprisonment:

sinaiticus.text: they were stoned, they were sawn asunder, they were tempted, they were slain with the sword, they wandered about in sheepskins, in goatskins, being destitute, afflicted, maltreated,

verses.text: they were stoned, they were sawn asunder, they were tempted, they were slain with the sword, they wandered about in sheepskins, in goatskins, being destitute, afflicted, maltreated,

sinaiticus.text: of whom the world was not worthy, wandering in deserts, and mountains, and caves, and dens of the earth.

verses.text: of whom the world was not worthy, wandering in deserts, and mountains, and caves, and dens of the earth.

sinaiticus.text: And these all having obtained a good report through faith received not the promise,

verses.text: And these all having obtained a good report through faith received not the promise,

sinaiticus.text: God having provided some better thing concerning us, that without us they should not be made perfect.404

verses.text: God having provided some better thing concerning us, that without us they should not be made perfect.404

sinaiticus.text: Therefore, having so great a cloud of witnesses lying round about us, let us also lay aside every weight and the sin that easily besets, and run with perseverance the race that lies before us,

verses.text: Therefore, having so great a cloud of witnesses lying round about us, let us also lay aside every weight and the sin that easily besets, and run with perseverance the race that lies before us,

sinaiticus.text: looking away to Jesus, the author and perfecter of the faith, who for the joy lying before him endured the cross, having despised the shame, and has sat down at the right hand of the throne of God.

verses.text: looking away to Jesus, the author and perfecter of the faith, who for the joy lying before him endured the cross, having despised the shame, and has sat down at the right hand of the throne of God.

sinaiticus.text: For consider him who endured such contradiction by sinners against himself, that you may not be weary, fainting in your souls.

verses.text: For consider him who endured such contradiction by sinners against himself, that you may not be weary, fainting in your souls.

sinaiticus.text: Not yet to blood have you resisted, striving against sin;

verses.text: Not yet to blood have you resisted, striving against sin;

sinaiticus.text: and you have forgotten the exhortation, which speaks to you as to sons: My son, despise not the chastisements of the Lord, neither be weary when corrected by him;

verses.text: and you have forgotten the exhortation, which speaks to you as to sons: My son, despise not the chastisements of the Lord, neither be weary when corrected by him;

sinaiticus.text: for whom the Lord loves he chastens, and scourges every son that he receives.

verses.text: for whom the Lord loves he chastens, and scourges every son that he receives.

sinaiticus.text: For chastisement you endure; God deals with you as with sons. For who is a son whom the father chastens not?

verses.text: For chastisement you endure; God deals with you as with sons. For who is a son whom the father chastens not?

sinaiticus.text: But if you are without chastisement, of which all have become partakers, then are you bastards and not sons.

verses.text: But if you are without chastisement, of which all have become partakers, then are you bastards and not sons.

sinaiticus.text: So, then, fathers of our flesh indeed have we had as chastisers, and we gave them reverence; shall we not much rather be in subjection to the Father of spirits and live?

verses.text: So, then, fathers of our flesh indeed have we had as chastisers, and we gave them reverence; shall we not much rather be in subjection to the Father of spirits and live?

sinaiticus.text: For they indeed for a few days chastened us according to their pleasure, but he for our profit, that we may partake of his holiness.

verses.text: For they indeed for a few days chastened us according to their pleasure, but he for our profit, that we may partake of his holiness.

sinaiticus.text: But all chastisement for the present indeed seems not a matter of joy, but of grief; afterward, however, it yields the peaceful fruit of righteousness to those that are exercised by it.

verses.text: But all chastisement for the present indeed seems not a matter of joy, but of grief; afterward, however, it yields the peaceful fruit of righteousness to those that are exercised by it.

sinaiticus.text: Wherefore set right again the hands that hang down and the enfeebled knees,

verses.text: Wherefore set right again the hands that hang down and the enfeebled knees,

sinaiticus.text: and make straight paths for your feet, that what is lame may not be turned out of the way, but may rather be healed.

verses.text: and make straight paths for your feet, that what is lame may not be turned out of the way, but may rather be healed.

sinaiticus.text: Pursue peace with all, and holiness, without which no one shall see the Lord,

verses.text: Pursue peace with all, and holiness, without which no one shall see the Lord,

sinaiticus.text: taking care lest anyone come short of the grace of God, lest any root of bitterness spring up and cause trouble, and by it the many be defiled,

verses.text: taking care lest anyone come short of the grace of God, lest any root of bitterness spring up and cause trouble, and by it the many be defiled,

sinaiticus.text: lest there be any lewd person, or profane, as Esau, who for one meal sold his birthright.

verses.text: lest there be any lewd person, or profane, as Esau, who for one meal sold his birthright.

sinaiticus.text: For you know that also afterward, wishing to inherit the blessing, he was rejected; for he found no place of repentance, though he sought it carefully with tears.

verses.text: For you know that also afterward, wishing to inherit the blessing, he was rejected; for he found no place of repentance, though he sought it carefully with tears.

sinaiticus.text: For you have not come to a mountain that is touched, and to

verses.text: For you have not come to a mountain that is touched, and to

sinaiticus.text: and the sound of a trumpet, and the voice of words, which they that heard entreated that a word should not be further spoken to them;

verses.text: and the sound of a trumpet, and the voice of words, which they that heard entreated that a word should not be further spoken to them;

sinaiticus.text: for they did not endure that which was commanded: If even a beast touch the mountain, it shall be stoned;

verses.text: for they did not endure that which was commanded: If even a beast touch the mountain, it shall be stoned;

sinaiticus.text: and so fearful was the sight, Moses said: I exceedingly fear and quake;

verses.text: and so fearful was the sight, Moses said: I exceedingly fear and quake;

sinaiticus.text: but you have come to mount Zion, and to the city of the living God, the heavenly Jerusalem, and to myriads,

verses.text: but you have come to mount Zion, and to the city of the living God, the heavenly Jerusalem, and to myriads,

sinaiticus.text: the festal assembly of angels, and to the church of firstborn ones enrolled in the heavens, and to the judge, God of all, and to the spirits of just men made perfect,

verses.text: the festal assembly of angels, and to the church of firstborn ones enrolled in the heavens, and to the judge, God of all, and to the spirits of just men made perfect,

sinaiticus.text: and to the mediator of the new covenant, Jesus, and to the blood of sprinkling that speaks more mightily than Abel.

verses.text: and to the mediator of the new covenant, Jesus, and to the blood of sprinkling that speaks more mightily than Abel.

sinaiticus.text: See that you refuse not him that speaks; for if they escaped not who refused him when giving oracles on earth, much more shall not we, if we turn away from him giving oracles from the heavens,

verses.text: See that you refuse not him that speaks; for if they escaped not who refused him when giving oracles on earth, much more shall not we, if we turn away from him giving oracles from the heavens,

sinaiticus.text: whose voice then shook the earth, but now he has promised, saying: Yet once more I will shake not the earth only, but also the heaven.

verses.text: whose voice then shook the earth, but now he has promised, saying: Yet once more I will shake not the earth only, but also the heaven.

sinaiticus.text: And the “Yet once” signifies the removal of the things shaken as of things that have been made, that the things not shaken may remain.

verses.text: And the “Yet once” signifies the removal of the things shaken as of things that have been made, that the things not shaken may remain.

sinaiticus.text: Wherefore, receiving a kingdom that cannot be shaken, let us have gratitude, by which we may serve God acceptably, with reverence and fear;

verses.text: Wherefore, receiving a kingdom that cannot be shaken, let us have gratitude, by which we may serve God acceptably, with reverence and fear;

sinaiticus.text: for our God is a consuming fire.

verses.text: for our God is a consuming fire.

sinaiticus.text: Let brotherly love continue.

verses.text: Let brotherly love continue.

sinaiticus.text: Be not forgetful of hospitality; for by means of it some have unconsciously entertained angels.

verses.text: Be not forgetful of hospitality; for by means of it some have unconsciously entertained angels.

sinaiticus.text: Remember those in bonds, as having been bound; those that suffer evil, as being yourselves also in the body.

verses.text: Remember those in bonds, as having been bound; those that suffer evil, as being yourselves also in the body.

sinaiticus.text: Let marriage be honored in all respects, and the bed be undefiled; but lewd persons and adulterers God will judge.

verses.text: Let marriage be honored in all respects, and the bed be undefiled; but lewd persons and adulterers God will judge.

sinaiticus.text: Let there be no money-loving disposition, being content with the things that you have; for he himself has said: I will never leave thee, nor will I in any way forsake thee;

verses.text: Let there be no money-loving disposition, being content with the things that you have; for he himself has said: I will never leave thee, nor will I in any way forsake thee;

sinaiticus.text: so that we may boldly say: The Lord is my helper, and I will not fear: what shall a man do to me?

verses.text: so that we may boldly say: The Lord is my helper, and I will not fear: what shall a man do to me?

sinaiticus.text: Remember your leaders, who spoke to you the word of God, the issue of whose life attentively considering, imitate their faith.

verses.text: Remember your leaders, who spoke to you the word of God, the issue of whose life attentively considering, imitate their faith.

sinaiticus.text: Jesus Christ is the same yesterday, to-day, and for ever,406

verses.text: Jesus Christ is the same yesterday, to-day, and for ever,406

sinaiticus.text: Be not carried away by various and strange teachings; for it is good that the heart be established with grace, not with meats, which have not profited those that have walked in them.

verses.text: Be not carried away by various and strange teachings; for it is good that the heart be established with grace, not with meats, which have not profited those that have walked in them.

sinaiticus.text: We have an altar, from which they have no right to eat that serve the tabernacle.

verses.text: We have an altar, from which they have no right to eat that serve the tabernacle.

sinaiticus.text: For the bodies of those animals, whose blood is carried by the chief priest into the sanctuary, are burned without the camp.

verses.text: For the bodies of those animals, whose blood is carried by the chief priest into the sanctuary, are burned without the camp.

sinaiticus.text: Wherefore Jesus also, that he might sanctify the people through his own blood, suffered without the gate.

verses.text: Wherefore Jesus also, that he might sanctify the people through his own blood, suffered without the gate.

sinaiticus.text: Therefore let us go forth to him without the camp bearing his reproach;

verses.text: Therefore let us go forth to him without the camp bearing his reproach;

sinaiticus.text: for here we have no continuing city, but we seek one that is to come.

verses.text: for here we have no continuing city, but we seek one that is to come.

sinaiticus.text: Through him therefore let us offer to God the sacrifice of praise continually, that is the fruit of lips that give thanks to his name.

verses.text: Through him therefore let us offer to God the sacrifice of praise continually, that is the fruit of lips that give thanks to his name.

sinaiticus.text: But to do good and to distribute forget not; for with such sacrifices God is well pleased.

verses.text: But to do good and to distribute forget not; for with such sacrifices God is well pleased.

sinaiticus.text: Obey your leaders and be submissive: for they watch for your souls, as they that shall give an account; that they may do this with joy, and not in grief; for this would be unprofitable for you.

verses.text: Obey your leaders and be submissive: for they watch for your souls, as they that shall give an account; that they may do this with joy, and not in grief; for this would be unprofitable for you.

sinaiticus.text: Pray for us; for we are persuaded that we have a good conscience, in all things willing to live honorably.

verses.text: Pray for us; for we are persuaded that we have a good conscience, in all things willing to live honorably.

sinaiticus.text: And the more abundantly do I beseech you to do this, that I may be restored to you the sooner.

verses.text: And the more abundantly do I beseech you to do this, that I may be restored to you the sooner.

sinaiticus.text: Now may the God of peace, who brought again from the dead the shepherd of the sheep who is great through the blood of the eternal covenant, our Lord Jesus,

verses.text: Now may the God of peace, who brought again from the dead the shepherd of the sheep who is great through the blood of the eternal covenant, our Lord Jesus,

sinaiticus.text: make you perfect in every good work that you may do his will, working in you that which is well-pleasing in his sight, through Jesus Christ; to whom be glory, through the ages: amen.

verses.text: make you perfect in every good work that you may do his will, working in you that which is well-pleasing in his sight, through Jesus Christ; to whom be glory, through the ages: amen.

sinaiticus.text: And I beseech you, brethren, bear with the word of exhortation; for I have written to you in few words.

verses.text: And I beseech you, brethren, bear with the word of exhortation; for I have written to you in few words.

sinaiticus.text: Know that our brother Timothy is set at liberty, with whom if he comes soon I will see you.

verses.text: Know that our brother Timothy is set at liberty, with whom if he comes soon I will see you.

sinaiticus.text: Salute all your leaders and all the saints. They of Italy salute you.

verses.text: Salute all your leaders and all the saints. They of Italy salute you.
